messages.content:
<smtcmp_block filename="ğŸ›ï¸CMDS/500. ğŸ› ï¸setting/502. CMDS setting/Plugins.md" language="markdown">
## Plugins

1. Outliner:
    - Allows free editing of bullet points.
    - `Ctrl + A` selects hierarchically based on Outliner's application, unlike the default whole-page selection.
2. Various Complements:
    - Features an auto-completion function for used terms.
3. Editing Toolbar:
    - Assists users unfamiliar with Markdown.
    - The eraser icon removes all formatting.
4. Highlightr:
    - Provides highlighting functionality. Colors can be customized.
    - Select text and press `Ctrl + P` to choose a color.
5. Translate:
    - Requires an API. Consider using another AI for translation.
6. Tag Wrangler:
    - Allows using and viewing tags as files with `/`. For example: `#category/subcategory`.
    - Renaming a tag in the right-hand pane renames it globally.
    - "New Search for..." finds files or projects related to a tag.
    - Bookmarking searches can be managed in the left sidebar. Tags can be used freely.
7. Note Refactor:
    - Used for splitting notes.
    - Select text within a note, press `Ctrl + P`, and choose from options like:
        - `Refactor: Contents only`
        - `Refactor: First line as file name`
        - `Refactor: Split note by headings`
    - It's recommended to have one topic per note and link them.
8. Templater:
    - `Alt + N`: Create a new note from a template.
    - `Ctrl + T`: Open the insert template menu.
    - `Ctrl + Alt + T`: Replace the template in the active file.
    - Templates start with `< %` and end with `%>`. Commands can be inserted using `[tp.]`.
    - Refer to `[[Template Syntax]]` for more details.
9. Calendar, Periodic Note:
    - Allows creation of daily notes for specific dates.
    - Click the calendar icon in the top right, then click a date to create a `[[ğŸ· Daily Notes]]`.
    - Periodic Note settings allow configuring the default file and template for new notes, which will be applied when creating notes from the calendar.
10. Paste URL into Selection:
    - Simplifies the process of creating Markdown links (`[title](url)`), which normally uses `Ctrl + K`.
    - Copy a URL, drag the text you want to use as the title, and press `Ctrl + V`. Example: `[obsidian_tip_link](https://slashpage.com/cmds-class)`
11. Korean Book Info:
    - For organizing Korean books.
    - Create a note as `[[Book title]]`. Within that note, press `Ctrl + P` and type `korea`.
    - Example: `[[ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ì² í•™í•˜ê¸° ì½”ë“œ ë„ˆë¨¸ì˜ ì‚¬ìœ  ê¸°ìˆ ê³¼ ì¡´ì¬ë¥¼ ì‡ë‹¤]]`
    - `[ì±…ì»¤ë²„|400]` followed by a URL will display the book cover image; the number adjusts the size.
12. Book Search:
    - Similar to "Korean Book Info." Configure book search in the settings template. Press `Ctrl + Shift + B` and search.
13. Obsidian Web Clipper:
    - Install the "Obsidian Web Clipper" extension.
    - In General settings, select only your Vault.
    - Enable Interpreter and add APIs to use.
    - Configure the template in settings by importing a template and setting properties.
    - Note content: The text within `\~~` is the prompt. English is recommended. Use double curly braces to delimit prompts. Headings can also be applied.
    - Interpreter context: Default prompt. Use only if the API cost is zero (e.g., Gemini).
14. Dataview:
    - Enable even if you don't use JavaScript.
    - Turns all properties and tags into a database.
    - `[[Dataview Test]]` is a test note; a syntax link is provided below.
    - Supports sorting.
15. Canvas:
    - Optionally set the file creation path in settings.
    - Use it freely. Markdown is supported.
    - Drag and drop notes into the canvas. Grouping notes or other items allows them to move together.
    - Images can also be inserted.
    - Useful for organizing notes for essays or projects based on Dataview organization.
    - Example: `[[Canvas_Test.canvas|Canvas_Test]]`
16. Excalidraw:
    - For drawing.
    - Hold `Shift` to adjust size and direction with fixed angles.
    - AI features can be used by connecting an API.
    - Example: `[[Drawing 2025-12-17 15.29.34.excalidraw|Excalidraw_Test]]`
17. Project:
    - Scheduled for re-release as "Bases."
18. Kanban:
    - Press `Ctrl + P` and search for "Kanban" to create a new board.
    - Organize tasks by category and check them off. Useful for to-do lists, tracking progress on projects, etc.
    - Settings are available for each Kanban note in the top left.
    - Example: `[[Kanban_Test]]`
19. Share Note:
    - Enable "Connect Plug" in options to open in external internet programs.
    - Use `Ctrl + P` to access the feature.
    - Shared links allow access from the web.
20. Omnisearch:
    - `Ctrl + Shift + O`: Vault search.
    - Searches for all files containing a keyword, not just files or folders.
    - To search Obsidian notes simultaneously with Google: Enable "HTTP Server" in options. Download the Tampermonkey extension from the Omnisearch website ([omnisearch](https://publish.obsidian.md/omnisearch/How+to+use+Omnisearch)). Follow the instructions in the "Inject Omnisearch results into your search engine" section. Install the extension via the provided link. Google searches will then show your Obsidian notes alongside results.
21. Graph View:
    - Filter using properties and other criteria.
    - Create groups by defining criteria and assigning colors.
    - `Ctrl + P` shows the local graph for the current file. "Depth" controls how many levels of connections are displayed.
22. Graph Analysis:
    - Sets the weight between nodes based on configured algorithms.
    - Enable only Adamic and Jaccard.
23. Strange New World:
    - Displays the number of times a note has been referenced.
    - Example: `[[CMDS Guide]]`
24. Minimal Theme:
    - Appearance -> Theme -> Minimal Theme.
    - Install "Minimal Theme Setting" from Community Plugins.
25. Style Settings:
    - Refer to video tutorials for usage. Customization options include backing up and importing styles.
    - Part 2, Chapter 7-2, 3 of the video series provides details.
26. Supercharged Links:
    - Lists notes based on defined criteria (e.g., tags, note paths).
    - Allows changing colors based on these criteria.
    - Customize link colors according to your preferences.
27. File Tree Alternative:
    - Using "Make.md" is a lightweight alternative for a Notion-like experience.
    - Install the "Make.md" plugin for Notion-like functionality instead of complex configurations.
28. Workspace Plus:
    - Save your current workspace layout with `Ctrl + U` after configuration.
    - Reloading Obsidian will restore the saved workspace layout when selected.
    - Shortcuts can be set to load specific workspaces.
29. Spaced Repetition:
    - For memorizing information, particularly for academic study.
    - Example: `[[Spaced repetition Test]]`
    - A recommended usage is to input lecture explanations into Gemini, then transform them into Spaced Repetition syntax, similar to how [notebookLM](https://notebooklm.google.com/) works.
    - Supports `Question::Answer` and `Answer:::Question` formats.
    - Use `#/flashcards/@@@` to categorize flashcard types by tag.
    - The effectiveness compared to NotebookLM is uncertain, as this is an optional plugin.
30. Smart Connections:
    - Primarily a paid plugin. Used to identify notes with the strongest connections based on weighting.
31. Smart Composer:
    - Assists in note-taking with AI.
    - Refer to `[[settingì—ì„œ smart composerì˜ Chat ì‹œìŠ¤í…œí”„ë¡¬í”„íŠ¸]]` for system prompts.
</smtcmp_block>

21. Graph View:
